p: The adaptation of A. aegypti to breed in peridomestic and domestic environments where they tend to enter homes, attracted by the human smell ( Weaver and Forrester, 2015), feeding mainly on humans ( Harrington et al., 2001) and laying eggs that survive on water poor in nutrients, has been primordial in the emergence of arboviruses associated with A. aegypti and has played an important role in the emergence of the global pandemic caused by CHIKV and ZIKV ( Weaver and Lecuit, 2015, Musso and Gubler, 2016).
